instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> GPU issue
threads.message:
Hello,
I got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with issues very similar to GPU issue of old MacBook pro 15" 2011 and 2012.

Can't load Mac Os, when is switch between internal to external GPU, MacBook restart.
Does anyone got a similar issue?
I have to replace the GPU ?
What diagnostic I need to do on the motherboard before replacing it ? 
Thank you for your help.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> GPU issue
threads.message:
Your diagnostic seems to be already done.
Reflow, or reball may fix the GPU issue for short time.
But the problem should be solved replacing it.
